content: <iframe height="0" src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-NM7L484" style="display:none;visibility:hidden" width="0"></iframe> FABMISR generates 8% higher net profit in 9M-25 after neutralizing FX impact First Abu Dhabi Bank Misr (FABMISR) 02 December 2025 06:59 PM FAB FAB 0.73% 16.62 0.12 Cairo – Mubasher: First Abu Dhabi Bank Misr (FABMISR), the banking business of the UAE listed FAB in Egypt, has delivered strong performance in its core business operations during the first nine months (9M) of 2025, according to a press release. The bank recorded an 8% growth in net profit to EGP 13.20 billion, after neutralizing the FX impact, compared to 9M-24, which reflected high operational efficiency and the successful execution of its strategy to drive sustainable value from core operations. The positive results were further reflected in shareholders’ equity, which grew by 19% to reach EGP 71.90 billion, reinforcing a robust capital base that supports the bank’s expansion plans. According to the financial results, total assets increased by 14% to EGP 472.40 billion, while the net loans and advances grew by 24% to EGP 176.50 billion. Customer confidence also remained strong, with customer deposits rising 20% to EGP 310.8 billion, reaffirming the ability of FABMISR to attract and retain deposits in a highly competitive banking environment. title: Wadi Kom Ombo records lower net profits at nearly EGP 2m in Q1-25/26
content: <iframe height="0" src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-NM7L484" style="display:none;visibility:hidden" width="0"></iframe> Wadi Kom Ombo records lower net profits at nearly EGP 2m in Q1-25/26 Photo Archive 02 December 2025 09:36 PM Wadi Kom Ombo WKOL -0.58% 312.51 -1.83 Cairo - Mubasher: The net profits after tax of Wadi Kom Ombo for Land Reclamation Company reached EGP 1.71 million in the first quarter (Q1) of fiscal year (FY) 2025/2026, marking a year-on-year (YoY) drop from EGP 15.52 million. The earnings per share (EPS) retreated to EGP 0.31 in Q1-25/26 from EGP 2.77 in the corresponding period a year earlier, according to the financial statements. Meanwhile, the continuing operating revenues totaled EGP 11.15 million in the July-September 2025 period, which signaled an annual plunge from EGP 23.90 million. The EGX-listed company posted EGP 772.28 million in total assets as of 30 September 2025, which came lower than EGP 776.71 million as of 30 June 2024. During the session, the stock tested an important and pivotal support level at EGP 6 - 6.10 which was retested multiple times, indicating the concentration of buying power. The level was also supported by the moving average, which represents a moving support for the stock. During the last period, the South Valley Cement stock saw some decline, as it started to form lower highs and lower lows. The stock is currently testing a strong resistance level at EGP 6.95, while holding above this resistance supports the stock's rise to the next resistance at EGP 7.40. Meanwhile, if it fails to hold and retreats, the stock is likely to test the main support again at EGP 6 - 6.10 pounds, and trading above this support level would back a positive outlook in the medium term. The new E-commerce Payments Interface is geared towards bolstering Saudi payment infrastructure and advancing the rapidly evolving ecommerce sector. Country Manager for Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, Jordan and other Levant at Mastercard, Saud Swar, said: “Mastercard is committed to powering economies and empowering people, and we understand the importance of robust infrastructure, secure technology, smart integration and collaboration, in the quest for a thriving digital economy. title: World’s 1st fintech-enabled Gold ATM launches in UAE
content: <iframe height="0" src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-NM7L484" style="display:none;visibility:hidden" width="0"></iframe> World’s 1st fintech-enabled Gold ATM launches in UAE Photo Gallery 03 December 2025 05:08 PM UAE – Mubasher: Emirates Gold has teamed up with Public Gold, Malaysia’s leading fintech-driven gold solutions provider, to launch the world’s first fintech-enabled Gold ATM in the UAE in a step that marks a major innovation milestone for both the Arab country and the global gold industry. The first ATM will be introduced at Almas Tower, with additional units planned across key destinations in the UAE, according to a press release. Emirates Gold which is one of the UAE’s most trusted and established precious metals refineries, in its collaboration with Public Gold, will deploy between 35 and 40 Gold ATM units across the country in 2026, forming the region’s largest network of its kind. Each ATM can hold over 70 designs of gold and silver bars, offering users convenient access to purchase bullion at any time while operating 24/7. Moreover, the smart Gold ATM integrates digital payments, bullion dispensing, and advanced security features into one seamless platform. Users can currently purchase gold or silver using e-wallets or credit cards, and withdraw physical bullion from their digital accounts, with additional features such as online order collection, cryptocurrency conversion, and redeeming tokenized gold from secure vaults planned for future i

title: World’s 1st fintech-enabled Gold ATM launches in UAE
content: <iframe height="0" src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-NM7L484" style="display:none;visibility:hidden" width="0"></iframe> World’s 1st fintech-enabled Gold ATM launches in UAE Photo Gallery 03 December 2025 05:08 PM UAE – Mubasher: Emirates Gold has teamed up with Public Gold, Malaysia’s leading fintech-driven gold solutions provider, to launch the world’s first fintech-enabled Gold ATM in the UAE in a step that marks a major innovation milestone for both the Arab country and the global gold industry. The first ATM will be introduced at Almas Tower, with additional units planned across key destinations in the UAE, according to a press release. Emirates Gold which is one of the UAE’s most trusted and established precious metals refineries, in its collaboration with Public Gold, will deploy between 35 and 40 Gold ATM units across the country in 2026, forming the region’s largest network of its kind. Each ATM can hold over 70 designs of gold and silver bars, offering users convenient access to purchase bullion at any time while operating 24/7. Moreover, the smart Gold ATM integrates digital payments, bullion dispensing, and advanced security features into one seamless platform. title: Gold stabilizes before the release of important US data
content: Markets: Gold prices stabilized today, Friday, after the rise in US Treasury bond yields erased the impact of the weakness of the dollar, with investors awaiting key inflation data to obtain indications about the path of the US Federal Reserve before next week’s meeting. Gold settled in spot transactions at $4,208.46 per ounce, and is heading for a weekly decline of 0.5%. US gold futures contracts for December delivery fell 0.1% to $4,237.70 per ounce. Bond yields hovered. The 10-year US Treasury is near its highest level in more than two weeks, while the dollar fell and remained near its lowest level in five weeks against a basket of currencies. “The market is waiting for new catalysts that could come in the form of what the Federal Reserve will do,” said Kunal Shah, head of research at Nirmal Bang Commodities. Are Treasury bond yields putting pressure on gold? Shah explained that high Treasury bond yields also play a role in putting pressure on gold prices. Most experts in a Reuters poll that included more than 100 economists expect the Federal Reserve to reduce the key interest rate by 25 basis points at its meeting, which will be held on December 9 and 10. Low interest rates usually support non-yielding assets such as gold. Investors are awaiting the personal consumption expenditures index for September, which is the Federal Reserve’s preferred inflation measure, which is scheduled to be issued at 15:00 GMT. As for other precious metals, silver rose 0.5% to $57.40. per ounce after it recorded a record high level at $58.98 on Wednesday, and is heading for weekly gains. Platinum fell 0.4% to $1,640.25 and is heading for a loss this week.

title: Saudi Arabia grants the economic license to the Russian “Azmuth” to operate regular flights between Russia and the Kingdom
content: Companies: The Saudi General Authority of Civil Aviation granted the economic license to the Russian “Azimuth” airlines to start operating regular flights (for passengers) between the Russian Federation and the Kingdom, heading from the cities of (Makhachkala - Mineralnye Vody) to Jeddah with 3 flights per week, starting from December 4 and 15, and from Sochi to Riyadh with two flights per week starting from March 3, 2026. This step comes within the framework of enhancing air connectivity and connecting Saudi Arabia to the world in order to achieve the goals of the vision. 2030, which is to make the Kingdom a global logistics platform and open new horizons for travel, compatible with the aviation program under the National Strategy for Transport and Logistics. From December 4 to 15, and from Sochi to Riyadh with two flights per week starting March 3, 2026. This step comes within the framework of enhancing air connectivity and connecting Saudi Arabia to the world in order to achieve the goals of Vision 2030 of making the Kingdom a global logistics platform and opening new horizons for travel, which is compatible with the aviation program under the National Strategy for Transport and Logistics.

title: The General Entertainment Authority is a strategic partner of the World of Customer Experience Forum in its third edition
content: Tourism and Entertainment: The General Entertainment Authority (GEA) announced its participation as a strategic partner in the World of Customer Experience Forum in its third edition, which is organized by the Saudi Customer Experience Association during the period from December 9 to 10 in Riyadh. The event comes as one of the prominent platforms that brings together specialists and those interested to exchange experiences, review best practices in the field of customer experience, and enhance the quality of services provided in various sectors. The forum offers an integrated program that includes dialogue sessions, presentations, workshops and an accompanying exhibition, in addition to an experience awards ceremony. Customer Experience Saudi Arabia 2026. The forum also hosts an elite group of experts and decision-makers from inside and outside the Kingdom, which enriches the dialogue on developing more advanced service environments and the ability to meet the needs of beneficiaries. The forum’s activities will be held in the Arena Hall, where the first day begins from nine in the morning until six in the evening, while the second day continues until four-thirty in the evening, and will conclude with the presentation of the Saudi Customer Experience Awards 2026 during an evening held from five to ten in the evening, in the presence of specialists and participating entities. The forum, through its sessions and topics, covered a number of topics, including the future of support services and interaction with beneficiaries, the sustainability of the experience, and the role of modern technologies in improving the quality of services, in addition to the logistical experience and its impact on customer satisfaction. The proposed sessions seek to provide applied content that reflects the development of the sector and keeps pace with the rapid changes in the business environment. This partnership comes within the framework of the General Entertainment Authority’s keenness to support initiatives that contribute to developing the comprehensive experience of the public, and to enhance paths to improve the services provided in the entertainment sector in line with its continuous growth.

title: Moore Chips ignites the Shanghai Stock Exchange on the first day of trading... it rose 469%
content: Companies: Shares of More Threads Technology, one of the most prominent artificial intelligence chip companies in China, jumped in its first trading on the Shanghai Stock Exchange after raising 8 billion yuan ($1.13 billion) in the second largest local initial offering this year. The company’s shares rose by 469% after it was offered at a price of 114.28 yuan per share. The offering witnessed strong demand from investors, as the tranche designated for individuals was subscribed at a rate of 2,750 times, even after redeeming a portion of the shares, making it the second most requested local IPO with a value exceeding one billion dollars since 2022, according to Bloomberg data. This strong start comes amid growing optimism about China’s efforts to achieve self-sufficiency in technology, in light of trade tensions and fears of American restrictions on advanced technologies. The company is also benefiting from the vacuum in which It was caused by NVIDIA's forced exit from the Chinese market. Earlier this year, regulators eased listing rules for unprofitable companies on the Nasdaq-like Star Board, to support local startups. Analyst Fan Qiyuan of Sinolink Securities said MoreThreads has a competitive technical advantage, benefiting from a "domestic substitution trend" driven by trade frictions with the United States and Beijing's quest to develop "national champions." He added that it is the only Chinese company capable of manufacturing multiple GPUs. Uses: Financing the next generation of artificial intelligence chips. The proceeds from the offering will be used to finance next-generation projects in artificial intelligence and graphics chips, in addition to enhancing working capital. This offering comes directly after Huandian New Energy's $2.7 billion offering in July. According to Sinolink Securities

title: Innovation and investment.. Riyadh on a European date to discuss “green” cooperation
content: NewsRiyadh will have a meeting with Europe on December 9 to discuss enhancing cooperation in green business, innovation and sustainable investment, according to the European Union Commission Delegation Office. A European Union delegation is currently visiting the Saudi capital and will organize a specialized media symposium to hold these discussions, which address priority sectors, including the circular economy, water, clean energy, sustainable manufacturing, and environmental technologies. The symposium, which will be held in cooperation with the “European-Gulf Cooperation on Green Transition” project and the European Chamber of Commerce in Saudi Arabia, will immediately follow the roundtable consultations. High-level meetings between the European Union and Saudi Arabia on green business and sustainable investment, according to the mission. Saudi and European companies meet in one place. The symposium brings together leading Saudi and European companies in this sector during the main event of the symposium, during which Dubravka Sojka, European Commissioner for the Mediterranean, will speak. The event aims to highlight opportunities to deepen cooperation between the European Union and Saudi Arabia in the private sector, exchange visions on emerging green value chains, investment priorities, and identify practical and implementable recommendations. And support long-term partnerships, and enhance the presence of European companies contributing to the green transformation in Saudi Arabia. The symposium discussions will focus on technological cooperation, regulatory harmonization, investment needs, and scalable business models, with the aim of building a more interconnected green business community between the European Union and Saudi Arabia. One of the results of the round table will be to present the European Union’s broader priorities and ideas in the region. A practical platform for exchanging visions between companies. title: Gulf concerns about the consequences of European “corporate sustainability due diligence” legislation
content: Companies The Gulf Cooperation Council countries expressed their deep concern regarding the two pieces of legislation known as the Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive and the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive, to which the set of amendments recently submitted by the European Parliament to the tripartite negotiations relate. The GCC countries, the Emirates, Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, the Sultanate of Oman, Qatar, and Kuwait, confirmed that their concern stems from the fact that these legislations will lead to obligating major companies, European and international, to follow the European Union concept of sustainability, as well as obliging them to comply with legislation related to human rights and the environment and to submit plans for climate change outside the framework of international climate agreements, in addition to the obligation to submit sustainability reports on the impacts of those companies, and to report that, and to impose fines on companies that fail to do so. Comply with this legislation. “Union of Gulf Chambers”: $550 billion in industrial investments. The volume of Gulf industrial investments exceeded $550 billion (about... Wed, 03 2025). The GCC countries explained that although the amendments presented by the European Parliament to contribute to alleviating the impact of some articles of the legislation and canceling others, the GCC countries still see that these amendments do not meet what they aspire to, and they still represent a source of harm and a potential source of broad risks to the interests of GCC companies operating in the market. The European Union, especially in light of the new regulatory environment imposed by the legislation, which may reflect negatively on the competitiveness of these companies and the continuity of their business. The GCC countries confirmed that they are still continuing their efforts as active members of all international organizations related to human rights, the environment, and climate change, and that they have aligned all their legislation with the principles of these organizations, taking into account the rights of the people.

title: The World Bank raises its growth forecast for the Saudi economy to 3.8% for the current year
content: News The World Bank raised its forecast for the growth of the Saudi economy during the current year to 3.8%, compared to 3.2% in last October’s forecast, indicating that Gulf economic growth has gained increasing momentum in 2025, supported by structural reforms and accelerating digital innovation, according to the latest edition of the economic developments report for the Gulf countries. The reforms support the flow of investments to Saudi Arabia. title: Global food prices fall for a third month in November
content: News The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) food price index recorded a new decline in November 2025, reaching 125.1 points, down 1.2% from October, continuing the decline trend for the third month in a row, according to a report by the organization today. Compared to the same period last year, the index remains 21.1% lower, and 35.2 points lower than the March 2022 peak, which was the result of global turmoil in markets. Commodities. Grains.. the only rise amid widespread declines. Unlike the rest of the commodity groups, grain prices rose to reach 105.5 points, an increase of 1.8% from October, despite remaining below last year’s levels. Despite abundant supplies and successful harvests in Argentina and Australia, wheat prices rose by 2.5% due to geopolitical and commercial factors. The most notable of these are potential Chinese interest in American wheat and continued tensions in the Black Sea region, in addition to expectations of a decline in cultivated areas in Russia. Prices of corn, barley, and sorghum also witnessed simultaneous increases, driven by increased demand and the disruption of work in the fields due to rain in major areas of Brazil and Argentina. On the other hand, global rice prices fell by 1.5% as a result of the entry of new crops into the markets and a decline in demand for imports. Vegetable oils... a decline to the lowest level in five months. The vegetable oil price index fell to 165.0 points, a decrease of 2.6% compared to October, with the prices of palm, rape, sunflower and soybean oils falling. This decline was due to: an unexpected increase in palm oil production in Malaysia, positive expectations for global rape production, high seasonal supplies of sunflower oil from the Black Sea region, and the impact of lower crude oil prices on the alternative oils market.

The head of the Saudi-Ukrainian Business Council, Yuri Melnyk, said in an interview with Okaz that the visit of a Ukrainian economic delegation of businessmen to Riyadh launched a “new strategic phase” in relations between the two countries, noting that the meetings held with Saudi officials and the private sector were a direct extension of the agreement between the leaderships of the two countries. Melnyk described the visit as “extremely productive,” stressing that a number of Ukrainian businessmen They are visiting the Kingdom for the first time. He said that the delegation was able to “stop the 10-year gap” in the work of the Business Council, adding: “We achieved what the leaders of the two countries agreed upon, and the agreements have actually begun to move.” Fundamental agreements to start joint work. Melnik explained that the two sides agreed on three main points, the first of which is establishing permanent communication channels between the Council and the private sector to enhance continuous communication, secondly removing procedural challenges such as accreditation, certificates and taxes to accelerate investment, and thirdly exchanging project portfolios.

Prices of the new version The “Model 3 Standard Range” model is sold in Germany at a price starting from 37,970. Euros, in Norway it is 330,056 kroner, and in Sweden it is 449,990 kroner. Tesla had previously launched a cheaper version of the Model Y in Europe and the United States. Compromises in specifications: The two cheaper versions lack some of the luxury finishes and advanced features found in the more expensive versions, but they still offer a driving range of more than 480 kilometers on a single charge. Collapse in European sales Tesla's sales in the European Union recorded a noticeable decline over the past months, after the Chinese company BYD surpassed them for the first time last spring to become the best-selling electric cars on the continent. Reasons for the decline: Analysts attribute a large part of this decline to the boycott of Tesla by European consumers due to Musk’s political stances, including his public support for President Donald Trump’s election campaign, and his later work in his administration, in addition to widespread controversy sparked by his movements and statements regarding far-right issues in Europe. Sharp criticism was also raised after his leadership of the “Government Efficiency Administration,” which implemented broad cuts in government jobs, before his resignation in May 2025 following a dispute with Trump over the tax law and tax law.

title: A technical disaster disrupts Edinburgh Airport for hours
content: Okaz > Miscellaneous Technical disaster disrupts Edinburgh Airport for hours December 5, 2025 - 22:30 | Last updated December 5, 2025 - 22:30 Edinburgh Airport grounded. Edinburgh Airport grounded. Edinburgh Airport grounded. --:-- Follow Okaz channel on WhatsApp Muhammad Siddiq Flights at Edinburgh Airport, the largest airport in Scotland, gradually resumed operation on Friday morning after a suspension of about two hours due to a technical malfunction in the air traffic control tower system. Details of the malfunction The airport announced through its official accounts that the first planes began taking off at 10:40 am local time, but some flights were delayed for up to two hours, and a number of incoming flights were diverted to other airports, while other flights were canceled during the afternoon. Airport statement: An airport spokesman said: “Flights resumed after addressing the technical malfunction that struck ANS, our air navigation services provider.” The malfunction was announced at 8:30 a.m., causing confusion among thousands of passengers inside the terminal, where they remained without accurate information for more than an hour. Affected flights: The impacts included flights of easyJet, British Airways, and Ryanair, and transatlantic flights of Delta and United Airlines, including a Delta flight coming from New York that was diverted to Dublin. Frequent disruptions in British shipping. Edinburgh Airport is the main air gateway to Scotland, and receives more than 15 million passengers annually heading to 155 destinations around the world. Its air traffic control services are managed by ANS, which attributed the malfunction to a “technical problem,” stressing that “passenger safety is the highest priority, and engineers worked at maximum speed to restore the system.” This was not the first incident; The airport was completely shut down last July due to a global malfunction in the CrowdStrike software that affected millions of computers
